content:
Ed Sheeran is an amazing artist! I'm glad you enjoyed his concert at Wembley Stadium. Tom Walker is indeed a talented singer-songwriter, and I'm not surprised you enjoyed his opening act.

If you like Ed Sheeran and Tom Walker, here are some similar artists you might enjoy:

1. James Bay: Known for his soulful voice and acoustic-driven sound, James Bay is a great match for Ed Sheeran fans. Check out his hits like "Hold Back the River" and "Us."
2. George Ezra: With his deep, raspy voice and folk-pop sound, George Ezra is a great fit for fans of Ed Sheeran's more acoustic tracks. Try " Budapest" and "Shotgun."
3. Hozier: This Irish singer-songwriter has a similar blend of folk, soul, and indie-rock elements. Check out his hits like "Take Me to Church" and "Jackie and Wilson."
4. Ben Howard: As a British singer-songwriter, Ben Howard's music often has a similar introspective and emotive quality to Ed Sheeran's work. Try "Keep Your Head Up" and "Old Pine."
5. Lewis Capaldi: This Scottish singer-songwriter has a powerful, soulful voice and a knack for crafting emotional, acoustic-driven ballads. Check out "Someone You Loved" and "Hold Me While You Wait."
6. Dean Lewis: This Australian singer-songwriter has a similar introspective and emotive style to Ed Sheeran. Try "Waves" and "Be Alright."
7. Vance Joy: As a Australian singer-songwriter, Vance Joy's music often has a similar folk-pop vibe to Ed Sheeran's work. Check out "Riptide" and "Fire and the Flood."
8. Passenger (Michael Rosenberg): With his soothing voice and acoustic-driven sound, Passenger is a great match for fans of Ed Sheeran's more mellow tracks. Try "Let Her Go" and "Holes."

These artists all share some similarities with Ed Sheeran and Tom Walker in terms of their acoustic-driven sound, emotive lyrics, and soulful vocals. Give them a listen and see if you discover any new favorite artists!
